sub_title: R&D (Remote Sensing for Water/Agriculture) at eLEAF
summary: I formulate remote sensing-based solutions and develop tools that translate pixels (data) into powerful insights and actionable information to enable evidence-based management, planning and governance decisions, aiming to tackle water and food insecurity challenges. For over six years, I have worked in various capacities with government, international organisation, INOGs, academia, and consultancy company to help clients (farmers, irrigation managers, river basin planners, government institutes and donors) in Africa, Asia, Australia and Europe.

school.name: IHE Delft Institute for Water Education

awards.description: A fully funded short term research scholarship was awarded to support me for translating my MSc research to a journal article that the WP practitioners worldwide can benefit from the framework I developed.

awards.title: Fellowship for MSc studies
awards.description: The fully funded scholarship was awarded to support my MSc study program at IHE Delft Institute for Water Education and stay in the Netherlands. The Orange Knowledge Programme aims to contribute to a society's sustainable and inclusive development. Its scholarships are open to mid-career professionals in specific countries.

publications.name: Translating open-source remote sensing data to crop water productivity improvement actions

authors.headline: R&D (Remote Sensing for Water/Agriculture) at eLEAF

profile_positions.title: Medior Researcher (R&D Remote Sensing for Water/Agriculture)

profile_positions.description: I conceptualize, design and develop remote sensing based applications for water and agriculture. Using earth observation data, we provide relevant data analytics to the governments, donors, irrigation scheme managers, farmers, inputs suppliers and traders at all levels for appropriate planning/strategizing/intervening.
profile_positions.title: Junior Researcher (R&D Remote Sensing for Water/Agriculture)

profile_positions.description: I translated remote sensing data to actionable information to improve crop yield and water productivity. I conceptualized and designed tools that enable users to better inform decisions with regard to crop yield and water consumption.
profile_positions.title: Geo-Analyst (Water and Agriculture)

profile_positions.description: I support Global Solutions Water at the WBG on remote sensing analysis for performance monitoring of irrigation schemes, with annotated outputs of key findings and their implications. The assignment is being conducted as part of a strategic review and planning discussion on irrigation schemes, using the Irrigation Operator of the Future (iOF) Toolkit. The toolkit supports operators to identify priority problems and define pragmatic responses to deal with them.
profile_positions.title: Consultant

company.name: IHE Delft Institute for Water Education

profile_positions.company: IHE Delft Institute for Water Education
profile_positions.description: I contributed as a guest lecturer to the Remote Sensing for Agricultural Water Management short-course. The three weeks course covered topics ranging from basic concepts of remote sensing to crop yield estimation, water productivity analysis and irrigation performance assessment. Solutions for agricultural water challenges in various contexts were discussed among 58 participants from 31 different countries.
profile_positions.title: Guest Lecturer

company.name: IHE Delft Institute for Water Education

profile_positions.company: IHE Delft Institute for Water Education
profile_positions.description: I developed a structured approach (framework) that assists practitioners to utilize open-source remote sensing data for improving agricultural water productivity. The framework (first-of-its-kind) enables the diagnosis of crucial WP factors such as crop water stress, irrigation uniformity, crop rotation, soil salinity, nitrogen application, and soil type. The framework is published as an open-access scientific article in the Agricultural Water Management Journal (DOI: 10.1016/j.agwat.2021.107373) funded by the Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
profile_positions.title: Academic Researcher

company.name: The World Bank funded project at the Ministry of Agriculture, Irrigation and Livestock

profile_positions.company: The World Bank funded project at the Ministry of Agriculture, Irrigation and Livestock
profile_positions.description: Was responsible for overall coordination of implementation activities among project units and with external stakeholders. Led regional team (of 14 professionals) on economic and institutional analysis, technical survey and design of irrigation schemes. Supervised estimation of crop water productivity, irrigation performance assessment. Supported capacity building and construction work monitoring. Received appreciation letter for excellent services from the governor of Laghman Province.
profile_positions.title: Water Management Specialist/Team Leader

profile_positions.description: Steered the bid evaluation process and reviewed irrigation schemes designs by external consultants
profile_positions.title: Hydraulic Engineer (Irrigation)

profile_positions.description: Managed a team of 18 professionals to construct drinking water supply infrastructure for disasters and conflicts affected communities.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager (Additional Charge)

profile_positions.description: Coordinated project activities among team members and with the relevant stakeholders. Represented ZOA-International in the national and provincial level meetings. Led water supply technical team of 5 professionals.
profile_positions.title: Water, Sanitation and Hygiene Coordinator

company.name: The World Bank funded project at the Ministry of Agriculture, Irrigation and Livestock

profile_positions.company: The World Bank funded project at the Ministry of Agriculture, Irrigation and Livestock
profile_positions.description: Collected field data and interviewed farmers for the diagnostic analysis before irrigation canal rehabilitation. Assisted performance assessment of irrigation canals. Supported hydraulic and graphic design of irrigation canals.
profile_positions.title: Intern (Water Management Unit)

company.name: Directorate General On-Farm Water Management, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa

profile_positions.company: Directorate General On-Farm Water Management, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa
profile_positions.description: Estimated crop water requirement of various crops. Estimated efficiency of various irrigation schemes. Assisted design of water storage tanks and tertiary watercourses. Assisted farmers’ capacity building programs on improved irrigation practices.
profile_positions.title: Intern (On-Farm Water Management)

company.name: Young Water Professionals for Sustainable Development Goals/MRRD-Kabul

volunteer_experiences.description: It's a formal platform of Afghan Students studying in Pakistan, to facilitate Afghan students in regarding admissions and accommodation issues in Pakistan.

I was elected for a one year term as a secretary of external affairs at the International Club (IC). The club provides avenues for students to develop a stronger relationship, test out their ideas, sharpen organizational and communication skill, gain managing and leadership experience and broaden their horizons outside academic life.

I was elected for a one year term as a secretary of culture at the International Club. The club provides avenues for students to develop a stronger relationship, test out their ideas, sharpen organizational and communication skill, gain managing and leadership experience and broaden their horizons outside academic life.
